posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
First off, Welcome!... not only to NWN but also to our little gathering of toon builders.   We are happy you found us at home.   If you have any general questions that do not pertain specifically to your request, post them in either the General Discussion subforum for build issues or the General subforum for generic NWN questions, please.  Now to business...

This is a build suggestion, based to some degree on what Empyre posted for the multicampaign 40-level version.  It has been optimized for playability of approximately Level 15 through Level 28 just for HotU (or 1 through 28 for SoU/HotU).  Actual campaign-specific spoiler-type information has been included... so be forewarned.
Spoiler [+]

Figure on wearing robes w/o shield.  I like the Isaac Sequencer myself.  The Monk 6 was slotted as early as possible for IKD (Lvl 22) but for a later Discipline and Tumble dump delay until Lvl 27.  I just like IKD much more and am willing to sacrifice 1 AC in a build where AC won't become an issue anyway.

This skill set will spot traps pretty quickly and be able to disarm all you encounter.  Just xclass them.  With +10 lockpicks, all locks should be pickable.  In a pinch, early on, use Trickery and Emp Cat buff and Emp Fox for disabling traps..  For a more trap-focused build and access to arcane scrolls/wands, sacrifice monk attack progression, feats and AC using rogue instead of monk.  Else, if you yield DW you can eliminate CoT altogether and add a few rogue skill dumps... but that's a different (and probably inferior) build due to the natural cleric/monk/CoT synergy.

Stealth is not used by creatures in HotU so no need for detection skills beyond Search.  Deekin is the only hench that you can drag from Ch1 to Ch3 but fortunately will be able to ID all loot you find as long as you ask him to focus on bard.  The few Lore checks you'll encounter are not part of the critical path and can always be bypassed.

HotU is gold-flushed so you should be able to fully enchant both kamas by selling loot.  If not, exploit Continual Flame.  Try to drag as much of the loot that surpasses the early chapter(s) redemption ceiling, to later chapters for best value.  Always pre-buff using Emp Fox prior to any Appraise check. Collect all magic bags since this is a DEX build and use your hench(es) to help haul the stuff.

There are very few battles that force you to use your hench, but in most combat, pre-buff by hench then solo will glean the highest XP.  HotU is one campaign where there are many convo triggers that add much to the enjoyment, so it's best to keep your party enlisted as much as possible between combat encounters.

Beware of trying to use spellcaster hench in combat.  Their AI forces them to buff fully prior to making attacks so if you force them to expel all their buffs prior to an encounter, they will most likely go offensive when combat triggers.  Removing melee weapons from their inventory will help prevent them from trying to tank.  You may want to try out Tony's AI once you've become familiar with NWN mechanics since it provides a bit more control for hench AI.
